ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: when he called on his Lord in secret
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: When he called to his Lord inwardly,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: when he cried to his Lord in secret.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: When he quietly called his Lord
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: When he softly prayed to his Lord.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: When he called his Lord [with] a call in secret.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: When he called upon his Lord in a low voice,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: when he called upon his Lord secretly
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: When he cried unto his Lord a cry in secret,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: when he called upon his Lord in low tones, saying,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Recall what time he cried unto his Lord with a cry secret.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: when he called out to his Lord with a secret cry.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Behold! he cried to his Lord in secret,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: When he called out his Lord (Allah) a call in secret,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: when he called upon his Lord in secret,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: When he called on his Lord, a call in seclusion.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: When he called to his Lord a private supplication.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [19:3] when (idh is semantically connected to rahma, ‘mercy’) he called out to his Lord a call, entailing a supplication, in secret, in the middle of the night, because this [time of the night] invites a faster response [to one’s supplication].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (When he cried unto his Lord) Zachariah called his Lord in the sanctuary (a cry in secret) in secret from his people,
